newsitem.title: GREECE: Strong quake hits southern Balkans, no injuries.
newsitem.headline: Strong quake hits southern Balkans, no injuries.

text.p: An earthquake measuring 5.5 on the open-ended Richter scale shook northern Greece, Albania and Macedonia on Friday, causing panic but no injuries, police said.
The quake hit at about 0700 GMT, jolting the northern Greek towns of Florina, Edessa, Kozani and Kastoria where people rushed out of their homes.

The Salonika University seismological department said the quake had its epicentre in the neighbouring former Yugoslav republic of Macedonia, near Lake Ohrid, where a number of old houses were damaged.
